help.name: mri_nu_correct.mni
help.description: Wrapper for nu_correct, a program from the Montreal Neurological Insitute (MNI) used for correcting intensity non-uniformity (ie, bias fields). You must have the MNI software installed on your system to run this. See www.bic.mni.mcgill.ca/software/N3 for more info.

required-flagged.explanation: input volume. Input can be any format accepted by mri_convert.
output volume. Output can be any format accepted by mri_convert. If the output format is COR, then the directory must exist.

Number of iterations to run nu_correct. Default is 4. This is the number of times that nu_correct is repeated (ie, using the output from the previous run as the input for the next). This is different than the -iterations option to nu_correct.
Passes Np as argument of the -iterations flag of nu_correct. This is different than the --n flag above. Default is not to pass nu_correct the -iterations flag.

optional-flagged.explanation: brainmask volume. Input can be any format accepted by mri_convert.

Passes thresh as argument of the -stop flag of nu_correct. According to the nu_correct documentation, this threshold is the "CV of change in field estimate below which iteration stops (suggest 0.01 to 0.0001)". Default is not to pass nu_correct the -stop flag.
Replace 0s with small random numbers then remove after nu (good for defaced data)
For use with data that is higher than 1mm resolution.
